data.value: Display as radio button list (vertical align)

data.name: plDefault.Help
data.value: New records will use this default value

data.name: plEditStyle.Help
data.value: Style which is applied on text box or list control in form, e.g. "width:300px"

data.name: plHelpText.Help
data.value: This is the Help Text displayed to the user to explain this field.

data.name: plName.Help
data.value:
Enter field name, strongly recommend enter latin characters. Note, some words are already used in product tables, so you can't enter them as field name.
The restricted words (case insensitive) include :Id, PortalId, TypeId, UserCategoryId, UserId, CreatedDate, Title,
Authed, Featured, Active, Summary, LinkUrl, Description, Thumbnail, Image,
Support, License, RoleAfterOrder, RoleAddDay, PurchasePrice, PromoPrice,
PromoStart, PromoEnd, StockQuantity, LowThreshold, Delivery, SpecialOffer,
Views, PublishDate, ExpireDate, Expired, LastModifiedDate, AllowComment, AllowRating,
RatingRoles, ViewRoles, CommentRoles, DownloadRoles,
AutoAuthComment, Order, Categories, Tags, RatingVotes, RatingTotal,
RatingAverage, Comments, UserName.

data.name: plRequired.Help
data.value: If checked, user must enter value for this field

data.name: plTitle.Help
data.value: Enter filed title which will be display when editing. Leave it as blank will use field name as edit title.

data.name: plType.Help
data.value: Choose data type. Note, it can't be modified after add, so choose it carefully when you add it first time.

data.name: plValidationMessage.Help
data.value: This message will be displayed if the user entered value violates the Validation Rule.

data.name: plValidationRule.Help
data.value: This Regular Expression is used to validate the value entered by the user. Failure to match this Regular Expression will prevent the record from being updated.

data.name: ExistingWords.Text
data.value: Field name already existing, please check it.

data.name: RestrictedWords.Text
data.value:
You enter a restricted words as field name, please change it. Some words are already used in product tables, so you can't enter them as field name.
The restricted words (case insensitive) include :Id, PortalId, TypeId, UserCategoryId, UserId, CreatedDate, Title,
Authed, Featured, Active, Summary, LinkUrl, Description, Thumbnail, Image,
Support, License, RoleAfterOrder, RoleAddDay, PurchasePrice, PromoPrice,
PromoStart, PromoEnd, StockQuantity, LowThreshold, Delivery, SpecialOffer,
Views, PublishDate, ExpireDate, Expired, LastModifiedDate, AllowComment, AllowRating,
RatingRoles, ViewRoles, CommentRoles, DownloadRoles,
AutoAuthComment, Order, Categories, Tags, RatingVotes, RatingTotal,
RatingAverage, Comments, UserName, ManufacturerId,
Field1, Field2, Field3, Field4, Field5,
PromoPriceAvailable, CurrentPrice, Longitude, Latitude, MapTitle,
RecursiveBill, BillPeriod, BillFrequency,
IsAuction, StartPrice, ReservePrice, BuyNowPrice,
TaxRateType, FixedTaxRate, ShippingFeeType, FixedShippingFee,
BidIncrement, AuctionCheck, AuctionCheckResult,
CountryId, Country, StateId, State, CityId, City, TownId, Town

data.name: Tip_AddAttribute.Text
data.value:
Attributes are used to create inter-dependant product variations. After create an attribute, you can then enter specific attribute values for an individual product.

  For example, if you want to create a "Color" attribute, you can do it as follows:
  1. Input "Color" as "Field Name". Note, the "Field Name" must be English characters (a-z and A-Z without blank space), it doesn't work for other languages. Howerver, other properties, like "Field Title" can accept Non-English characters (e.g, Chinese, Russian..etc).
  2. Input "Cloth Color" as "Field Title" (optional) .
  3. Input "Enter cloth color, like red, green, white" as "Help Text" (optional).
  4. Click "Update"
  Then you will see a "Cloth Color" field while editing products at "Cp_Admin sub module - Seller Center" section. You can specify different value for each product (e.g. "White", "Red").

  You can also provide a list of values to choose. For example, if you input "red;green;white" (separate by semicolon, name|value pairs like "One|1;Two|2;Three|3" also acceptable) as "List of Values", then product can only choose value from "red", "green" and "white". You can even specify a default value. For example, if you input "red" as "Default Value", then product "color" value will be set as "red" by default.

  If you provide "list of values", you can specify value selection style. The "Drop down list" (and "Radio button list") display styles only allows to select 1 item from "List of values". The "Check box list" style allows to select multiple items from "List of values". You can also input multiple values like "red;green" in "Default Value" for "check box list" display style, so both "red" and "green" check box will be chosen by default.

  When searching these attributes in Cp_Product_Search (or Cp_Product_List) sub module, these list of values (and its display style) are also available. For example, when you create a "Color" attribute, specify its value as "red;green;white", and choose its display style as "Drop down list", then visitors can search "Color" in Cp_Product_Search (or Cp_Product_List) sub module by select "red" (or "green" / "white") from a drop down list.

  Note, while you can create attributes which "Data Type" is "Text Html" here, we don't recommend you to do so. If you need to publish extra long content (html based), we recommend you to use the "Specification 1-5" feature in "Cp_Admin sub module - Admin Control Panel - Departments" section instead.

data.value: Display as check box list (horizontal align)
